Frequently Asked Questions

General questions

  1. Is JAVAGALICIAN any kind of official project? Is it sponsored or endorsed by any public institution or private company?
  2. Which are the standards used for creating the localized texts?
  3. Is there any commercial support available?

General questions

Is JAVAGALICIAN any kind of official project? Is it sponsored or endorsed by any public institution or private company?

No, it is not. JAVAGALICIAN is an independent open-source project, and it has no relation at all with any institutions or companies of any kind.

[top]

Which are the standards used for creating the localized texts?

JAVAGALICIAN has been made compliant with the latest revision of the official norms of grammar, spelling and vocabulary promulgated by the Real Academia Galega (Royal Galician Academy) as of 2009.

The following texts have been used as a reference:

  • Novo dicionario da lingua galega. Ed. Obradoiro-Santillana, 2005.
  • Dicionario Galaxia de usos e dificultades da lingua galega. Ed. Galaxia, 2004.
  • Dicionario Castelán-Galego da Real Academia Galega. Real Academia Galega e Fundación Pedro Barrié de la Maza, 2004.

[top]

Is there any commercial support available?

No, there is not.

[top]
